div.l: Farre in þe norþe I can notte telle where
This Aleyn makeþe redye All his gere
And on A horse the sacke he caste anone
Forþe gothe Aleyn the Clarke ⁊and Allso Iohn
With gode swerde ⁊and buckeler by her syde
Iohn knewe þe waye hym nedede no gyde
And atte þe Mylle downe þe sacke he layethe
Aleyn spake Firste All hayle Symon in Faythe
How Fares thy Fayer doughter ⁊and thy wyfe
Aleyn wellcome qduod Symken by my lyfe
And Iohn allso how now whatt doo ye here
By god qduod Iohn Symon nede haþe no pere
Hym behoues sarue hym selfe þat haþe no swayne
Or ellese he is a Fole as Clarkes sayene
Ower Manciple I hope he woll be dede
Swa werkes hym Ay the wanges in his hede
And therfor is I come ⁊and eke Aleyn
To grynde ower corne And Carrye itt home agayne
I praye you spede vs heþen þat we maye
Hitt schall be doone qduod Symkyn by my Faye
Whatt woll ye doone whyle þat itt is on hande
Bigod righte by the hopir woll I stonde
Qduod Iohn And se howgates gase ynne
Yett sawe I neủer by my Fadre synne
How that the hopir wagges to ⁊and Froo
Alayn answerede Iohn wollte thow swa
Than woll I be beneþe by my Crowne
And se howgates the Mele Falles Adowne
Into the troughe that schall be my disporte
Qduod Iohn yfaythe I maye be of your Sorte
I is As elle a Myller As ere ye
This Myller smylede of her nycyte
And þoughte all this is doone butte For A wyle
